subject: Re: A shipment from order #SSN1620 is on the way
description_text:
Hello,
I received the VAM haptics yesterday, set them up on my pedals, but I am
having 2 issues.

1. The vibration from one is way, way less than the other. I tried
switching the plugs around, and it is still not working correctly. It
vibrates a little, but nothing like the other one. I think 1 of them is
defective.

2. When I am in iRacing, neither haptic does anything. I have tried setting
them up in Simsonn Manager, and have tried turning on Wheel Slip, Wheel
Lock, ABS, TC. No matter what I do, when I race, nothing happens. Please
let me know if this is a settings issue, or if there is something else I
need to do to get them to work.

I appreciate your help. I really love your pedals, and I was excited to try
your haptics. I know this is a new product for you, but obviously this is
very disappointing.

Thanks,
Manhar Dalal

conversations.body_text: Hi Manhar Dalal,    Please provide your order number and the model of your pedal set.  For now, you can use SIMHUB version 9.9.3. Our SIMSONN Manager will officially support iRacing in the upcoming version 2.0.9. Please note that some games, such as iRacing, do not directly provide ABS or TC (traction control) data. SIMHUB uses algorithms to simulate these effects and generate vibration feedback.  Regarding the issue you reported with the VAM, we will send you a replacement free of charge.  As for usage recommendations: In Speed mode, excessive travel or continuous rotation may lead to motor damage. We suggest setting a reasonable speed range and limiting the vibration intensity to around 50%, with a maximum of 70%. Also, try to avoid prolonged continuous operation to extend the motor's lifespan.

Hello,  I purchased my pedals last year, on Amazon. The model is SPRO-LC. The Amazon order number is: 113-3678755-5734630.     I will try them with SimHub, but one of them is still clearly defective. Please make sure you use my shipping address, which is:  P.O. Box 6375  Baltimore, MD 21230     Thank you!
Hi Manhar Dalal,  Could you try swapping the two motors on the control box ports? This will help us determine whether the issue is with the controller itself.

Hello,
I tried that already. When I switched them, the same motor still had the
same issue.

Manhar

Manhar Dalal
manhardalal@gmail.com

On Wed, Jul 16, 2025, 1:03 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Manhar Dalal,  Please update to SIMSONN Manager version 2.0.9 and SIMHUB version 9.9.3. After updating, please test whether the motor operates normally. If it's confirmed that the motor was damaged due to excessive vibration strength, we will send you a free replacement VAM motor. Kindly provide your order number and shipping address so we can arrange the replacement promptly.  Note: Version 2.0.9 will automatically limit the maximum vibration strength of the VAM motor to 30% or 50% to prevent damage caused by overly aggressive settings.
